alert.note: Alert for Northern Clinton; Northern Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 03 at 4:02AM EST until February 04 at 10:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of up to one quarter of an inch. * WHERE...Northern Clinton, Sullivan and Northern Lycoming Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel disruptions are likely. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to a wintry mix this afternoon and continue through tonight. The heaviest ice accumulation is expected in Sullivan County.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
